abstractText: Avery and Burkhart (1994) defined basal area as the sum of the cross sectional areas of all tree stems in a stand measured at breast height (4.5 feet) and expressed as per unit of land area i.e., ft2/acre or m2/hectare (envision measuring the surface area, including bark, on the top of all tree stumps cut at 4.5 feet above the ground).
title: Tree Measurements - Basal Area v1.0
